landing.title: गुर्दा उपचार निर्णय सहायता
landing.subtitle: NHS गुर्दा सेवाएं
landing.description: यह उपकरण आपको अपने गुर्दा उपचार विकल्पों को समझने और यह सोचने में मदद करेगा कि आपके लिए सबसे महत्वपूर्ण क्या है। अपना समय लें - कोई सही या गलत उत्तर नहीं है।
landing.startButtonAriaLabel: Start your kidney treatment decision journey
landing.learnMore: इस उपकरण के बारे में और जानें
landing.featuresSubtitle: Everything you need to make an informed decision about your kidney treatment

time.title: Takes About 15 Minutes
time.description: Complete at your own pace. You can take breaks whenever you need and return to where you left off.

privacy.title: Your Privacy Protected
privacy.description: No personal information is stored. Your answers help personalise the tool during this session only.

devices.title: Works on All Devices
devices.description: Use on your phone, tablet, or computer. The tool adapts to your screen size automatically.

learn.title: Learn
learn.description: This decision aid will help you explore the different treatment options available for kidney failure. You can learn about each treatment at your own pace, think about what matters most to you, and create a summary to share with your doctor or nurse.

explore.title: Explore
explore.description: You will answer a few simple questions about your situation, then explore treatments that may be suitable for you. Your information stays private and is not saved after you close the browser.

decide.title: Decide
decide.description: This tool does not replace medical advice from your healthcare team. It is designed to help you feel more informed and confident when discussing your options. Your kidney team are the experts in your care and will help you make the right decision for you.

about.paragraph1: This decision aid will help you explore the different treatment options available for kidney failure. You can learn about each treatment at your own pace, think about what matters most to you, and create a summary to share with your doctor or nurse.
about.paragraph2: You will answer a few simple questions about your situation, then explore treatments that may be suitable for you. Your information stays private and is not saved after you close the browser.
about.paragraph3: This tool does not replace medical advice from your healthcare team. It is designed to help you feel more informed and confident when discussing your options. Your kidney team are the experts in your care and will help you make the right decision for you.

landing.ctaDescription: Take the first step towards understanding your kidney treatment options. You can start now and come back later if you need a break.

language.title: अपनी भाषा चुनें
language.instruction: कृपया अपनी पसंदीदा भाषा चुनें। आप इसे कभी भी बदल सकते हैं।

privacy.title: आपकी गोपनीयता और जानकारी
privacy.subtitle: Before you begin, we want you to understand how this tool handles your information.

privacy.title: हम आपकी जानकारी की सुरक्षा कैसे करते हैं
privacy.content: आपकी प्रतिक्रियाएं सुरक्षित रूप से संसाधित की जाती हैं और स्थायी रूप से संग्रहीत नहीं की जाती हैं। यह उपकरण व्यक्तिगत स्वास्थ्य जानकारी एकत्र नहीं करता है जो आपकी पहचान कर सके। जब आप इस उपकरण को बंद करते हैं तो आपका सत्र डेटा स्वचालित रूप से हटा दिया जाता है।
privacy.p1: This tool uses session-only storage. Any information you enter, including your answers to questions and treatment preferences, is only kept while you are using the tool.
privacy.p2: When you close your browser or after 15 minutes of inactivity, all your information is automatically deleted. We do not save anything about you.
privacy.p3: We collect anonymous information about how people use this tool to help us improve it. This cannot identify you personally.

ai.title: यह उपकरण कैसे काम करता है
ai.content: यह निर्णय सहायता आपकी प्रतिक्रियाओं के आधार पर व्यक्तिगत जानकारी प्रदान करने के लिए प्रौद्योगिकी का उपयोग करती है। प्रदान की गई जानकारी NHS नैदानिक दिशानिर्देशों और साक्ष्य-आधारित शोध से ली गई है। यह उपकरण आपकी गुर्दा देखभाल टीम के साथ चर्चाओं का समर्थन करता है, लेकिन उनका स्थान नहीं लेता।
ai.p1: This tool includes an AI assistant that can answer general questions about kidney treatments. The AI provides information only - it cannot give you medical advice specific to your situation.
ai.p2: The AI may sometimes make mistakes or provide incomplete information. Always discuss important decisions with your kidney team who know your full medical history.
ai.p3: This tool does not replace advice from your healthcare team. It is designed to help you feel more informed when discussing your options with your doctors and nurses.

medical.title: महत्वपूर्ण चिकित्सा जानकारी
medical.content: यह उपकरण गुर्दा उपचार विकल्पों के बारे में सामान्य जानकारी प्रदान करता है। यह पेशेवर चिकित्सा सलाह, निदान या उपचार का विकल्प नहीं है। अपने उपचार के बारे में कोई भी निर्णय लेने से पहले हमेशा अपने गुर्दा विशेषज्ञ या स्वास्थ्य देखभाल टीम से परामर्श करें। यदि आपको तत्काल स्वास्थ्य संबंधी चिंताएं हैं, तो कृपया अपने GP से संपर्क करें या NHS 111 पर कॉल करें।

pii.title: Please Do Not Share Personal Details
pii.intro: To protect your privacy, please do not enter any personal information that could identify you when using this tool, especially in the chat feature.
pii.outro: You can still tell us about your situation in general terms - for example, your living situation or what matters most to you - without sharing identifying details.

summary.title: In Summary
summary.leave: You can leave at any time

consent.title: Please confirm to continue
consent.understand: I understand that my information is not saved after this session and I will not share personal identifying information
consent.analytics: I agree to anonymous analytics being collected to help improve this tool (optional)
consent.error: Please confirm you understand the privacy information before continuing

privacy.readFullPolicy: Read the full NHS Privacy Policy

journey.title: आप अपनी गुर्दा देखभाल यात्रा में कहां हैं?
journey.instruction: वह विकल्प चुनें जो आपकी वर्तमान स्थिति का सबसे अच्छा वर्णन करता है

newlyDiagnosed.title: I think I may have kidney disease
newlyDiagnosed.description: You are concerned about your kidney health and want to learn more about what this might mean.

monitoring.title: I've just been diagnosed - early stage CKD
monitoring.description: You have recently learned about your kidney condition and are being monitored.

preparing.title: I've been diagnosed - late stage CKD
preparing.description: Your kidney function has declined significantly and you are learning about treatment options.

onDialysis.title: I need to choose a treatment soon
onDialysis.description: Your kidney team has told you that you will need to make a treatment decision soon.

transplantWaiting.title: I'm due to have a transplant - want to learn more
transplantWaiting.description: You are on the transplant list or have a living donor arranged.

postTransplant.title: I'm due to start dialysis - want to learn more
postTransplant.description: You will be starting dialysis treatment soon and want to understand what to expect.

supporting.title: I'm supporting a family member or friend
supporting.description: Someone close to you has kidney disease and you want to help them understand their options.

knowledge.title: How much do you know about kidney disease and its treatments?
knowledge.hint: This helps us tailor information to your current understanding.

goal.title: What would you like to get from this session?
goal.hint: Select the option that best describes your main goal today.

learning.title: How do you prefer to learn new information?
learning.hint: This helps us present information in ways that work best for you.

comfort.title: How comfortable are you with medical procedures?
comfort.hint: This is a sensitive topic. You can skip this question if you prefer.

support.title: Do you have support at home?
support.hint: Some treatments are easier with help from family or carers.

living.title: Where do you live?
living.hint: This helps us understand which treatments might work best in your home environment.

priorities.title: What matters most to you in choosing a treatment?
priorities.hint: Your priorities will help us highlight what matters to you in each treatment option.

ageRange.title: What is your age range?
ageRange.description: This helps us provide relevant information about treatment options

livingSituation.title: What is your current living situation?
livingSituation.description: Your living situation can affect which treatments work best for you

workStatus.title: What is your current work status?
workStatus.description: This helps us understand how treatment might fit into your daily life

supportAvailable.title: Do you have someone who can help support you with your care?
supportAvailable.description: Having support can influence which treatment options might work best for you

importantFactors.title: What is most important to you?
importantFactors.description: Select all that apply. This helps us understand your priorities
importantFactors.helpText: You can select more than one option

healthConcerns.title: Do you have any of these health conditions?
healthConcerns.description: This is optional but can help provide more relevant information

learnBasics.label: Learn the basics about kidney treatment
learnBasics.description: I want a general understanding of what my options are

compare.label: Compare different treatment options
compare.description: I want to understand how treatments differ from each other

prepare.label: Prepare for a discussion with my kidney team
prepare.description: I want to be ready with questions and understand what to ask

support.label: Support a family member or friend
support.description: I want to help someone I care about understand their options

notSure.label: I am not sure yet
notSure.description: I would like to explore and see what might be helpful

visual.label: Pictures and diagrams
visual.description: I understand things better when I can see them illustrated

audio.label: Listening to explanations
audio.description: I prefer to hear information spoken aloud

reading.label: Reading text at my own pace
reading.description: I like to read and re-read information carefully

video.label: Watching videos
video.description: I learn well from video demonstrations and stories

interactive.label: Interactive activities
interactive.description: I learn by doing, exploring, and trying things out

options.familyPartner: Yes, I live with family or a partner who can help
options.carers: Yes, I have carers who visit regularly
options.familyNearby: I live alone but have family nearby
options.limitedSupport: I live alone with limited support

options.homeSpace: In my own home with space for equipment
options.homeLimited: In my own home with limited space
options.supported: In supported housing or care home

options.control: Feeling in control of my treatment

options.careFacility: I live in a care facility

options.yesRegular: Yes, I have regular support available
options.yesSometimes: Yes, I have some support available
options.no: No, I do not have support available

treatments.title: अपने उपचार विकल्पों को समझना
treatments.subtitle: गुर्दे की विफलता के उपचार के विभिन्न तरीके हैं। प्रत्येक के लाभ और विचारणीय बातें हैं।

transplant.title: गुर्दा प्रत्यारोपण
transplant.shortDescription: एक दाता से स्वस्थ गुर्दा प्राप्त करना
transplant.description: गुर्दा प्रत्यारोपण में या तो जीवित दाता (जैसे परिवार का सदस्य या मित्र) या मृतक दाता से स्वस्थ गुर्दा प्राप्त करना शामिल है। एक सफल प्रत्यारोपण गुर्दे की विफलता वाले कई लोगों के लिए सबसे अच्छी जीवन गुणवत्ता और सबसे लंबा जीवन प्रदान कर सकता है।
benefits: अक्सर सबसे अच्छी जीवन गुणवत्ता प्रदान करता है
नियमित डायलिसिस सत्रों की आवश्यकता नहीं
अधिकांश लोगों के लिए बेहतर ऊर्जा स्तर
considerations: बड़ी सर्जरी की आवश्यकता होती है
जीवन भर इम्यूनोसप्रेसेंट दवाइयां लेनी पड़ती हैं
उपयुक्त गुर्दे के लिए प्रतीक्षा करनी पड़ सकती है

hemodialysis.title: हीमोडायलिसिस
hemodialysis.shortDescription: मशीन का उपयोग करके रक्त को छानना
hemodialysis.description: हीमोडायलिसिस आपके शरीर के बाहर आपके रक्त को छानने के लिए एक मशीन का उपयोग करता है। यह आमतौर पर अस्पताल या सामुदायिक केंद्र में डायलिसिस इकाई में किया जाता है, आमतौर पर सप्ताह में तीन बार लगभग चार घंटे प्रत्येक सत्र के लिए। कुछ लोग घर पर हीमोडायलिसिस करते हैं।
benefits: अपशिष्ट और अतिरिक्त तरल पदार्थ को हटाने में प्रभावी
स्वास्थ्य देखभाल टीम के साथ नियमित संपर्क
कुछ के लिए घरेलू हीमोडायलिसिस विकल्प उपलब्ध
उपचार आपके लिए किया जाता है
considerations: नियमित अस्पताल या केंद्र जाने की आवश्यकता
संवहनी पहुंच (फिस्टुला या लाइन) की आवश्यकता
उपचार के बाद थकान महसूस हो सकती है
आहार और तरल पदार्थ प्रतिबंध लागू होते हैं

peritonealDialysis.title: पेरिटोनियल डायलिसिस
peritonealDialysis.shortDescription: पेट की परत का उपयोग करके शरीर के अंदर रक्त को छानना
peritonealDialysis.description: पेरिटोनियल डायलिसिस आपके पेट की परत (पेरिटोनियम) को प्राकृतिक फिल्टर के रूप में उपयोग करता है। एक विशेष तरल पदार्थ एक छोटी ट्यूब के माध्यम से आपके पेट में डाला जाता है, अपशिष्ट उत्पादों को अवशोषित करता है, और फिर निकाल दिया जाता है। यह घर पर किया जा सकता है, या तो दिन के दौरान या रात भर जब आप सोते हैं।
benefits: घर पर किया जाता है, अधिक स्वतंत्रता
considerations: आपके पेट में स्थायी ट्यूब की आवश्यकता
तकनीक बनाए न रखने पर संक्रमण का खतरा
आपूर्ति के लिए भंडारण स्थान की आवश्यकता

conservative.title: रूढ़िवादी प्रबंधन
conservative.shortDescription: डायलिसिस के बिना लक्षणों का प्रबंधन
conservative.description: रूढ़िवादी प्रबंधन डायलिसिस या प्रत्यारोपण के बिना जीवन की गुणवत्ता बनाए रखने और लक्षणों के प्रबंधन पर केंद्रित है। यह दृष्टिकोण कुछ लोगों के लिए सही हो सकता है, विशेष रूप से जो बुजुर्ग, कमजोर हैं, या अन्य गंभीर स्वास्थ्य स्थितियां हैं। इसमें सावधानीपूर्ण लक्षण प्रबंधन, दवाइयां और गुर्दा देखभाल टीम से सहायता शामिल है।
benefits: कोई डायलिसिस सत्र या सर्जरी की आवश्यकता नहीं
जीवन की गुणवत्ता और आराम पर ध्यान
कुछ बुजुर्ग या कमजोर रोगियों के लिए उपयुक्त हो सकता है
जितना संभव हो सामान्य दिनचर्या बनाए रखें
considerations: लक्षणों को सक्रिय प्रबंधन की आवश्यकता होगी
अपेक्षाओं के बारे में ईमानदार बातचीत महत्वपूर्ण है
अग्रिम देखभाल योजना की सिफारिश की जाती है

facts.comfort: Focus on comfort and quality of life

transplant.title: Kidney Transplant
transplant.subtitle: Receiving a healthy kidney from a donor
transplant.description: A kidney transplant involves receiving a healthy kidney from either a living donor (such as a family member or friend) or a deceased donor. A successful transplant can provide the best quality of life and longest survival for many people with kidney failure.

overview.p1: A kidney transplant is often considered the best treatment option for kidney failure because it can restore nearly normal kidney function and provide the best quality of life.
overview.p2: You can receive a kidney from a living donor (family member, friend, or altruistic donor) or from someone who has died (deceased donor). Living donor transplants often work better and last longer.

assessment.title: Assessment
assessment.content: Your kidney team will assess whether you are suitable for a transplant. This includes checking your overall health and doing various tests.

donor.title: Finding a donor
donor.content: If you have a willing living donor, they will be tested for compatibility. Otherwise, you will be placed on the national waiting list for a deceased donor kidney.

operation.title: The operation
operation.content: Transplant surgery takes 2-4 hours. The new kidney is placed in your lower abdomen and connected to your blood vessels and bladder.

recovery.title: Recovery
recovery.content: Most people stay in hospital for 5-7 days after the operation. Full recovery takes about 3 months, though you may feel much better within weeks.

considerations.surgery: Requires major surgery with associated risks
considerations.medication: Need to take immunosuppressant medications for life
considerations.waitingList: May need to wait years for a suitable kidney from the waiting list
considerations.suitability: Not suitable for everyone - depends on overall health
considerations.rejection: Risk of rejection - the new kidney may stop working over time
considerations.infections: Increased risk of infections due to immunosuppression

travel.title: Travel
travel.content: After recovery, most transplant patients can travel freely. You will need to carry your medications and may need to plan access to medical care at your destination.

work.title: Work
work.content: Most people can return to work 2-3 months after transplant surgery, though this varies depending on your job and recovery.

diet.title: Diet
diet.content: Dietary restrictions are usually much less strict than with dialysis. However, you should maintain a healthy diet and be careful about food hygiene due to immunosuppression.

referral.title: Referral and assessment
referral.description: Your kidney team will refer you for transplant assessment if they think you may be suitable.

findingDonor.title: Finding a donor
findingDonor.description: Explore living donation options with family and friends, or join the waiting list for a deceased donor kidney.

preparation.title: Preparation
preparation.description: Stay as healthy as possible while waiting. Complete any required tests and keep your contact details up to date.

transplant.title: The transplant
transplant.description: When a suitable kidney becomes available, you will be called to hospital for the operation.

followup.title: Recovery and follow-up
followup.description: After surgery, you will have regular clinic visits to monitor your new kidney and adjust medications.

q1.question: How long does a transplanted kidney last?
q1.answer: On average, a kidney from a living donor lasts 15-20 years, and a kidney from a deceased donor lasts 10-15 years. Some transplants last much longer.

q2.question: Can I still have a transplant if I am on dialysis?
q2.answer: Yes. Many people receive a transplant while on dialysis. However, transplant outcomes are generally better if you can have a transplant before needing dialysis.

q3.question: What are the risks of surgery?
q3.answer: Like any major surgery, there are risks including bleeding, infection, blood clots, and reactions to anaesthesia. Your surgical team will explain these risks in detail.

q4.question: Will I feel the new kidney?
q4.answer: No. The new kidney is placed in your lower abdomen and you will not feel it working. Your old kidneys are usually left in place.

james.quote: Getting my transplant was life-changing. I went from feeling exhausted on dialysis to having energy to play with my grandchildren again.
james.name: James

sarah.quote: My husband donated his kidney to me. It was a big decision but we went through the process together and our bond is even stronger now.
sarah.name: Sarah

hemodialysis.title: Hospital Haemodialysis
hemodialysis.subtitle: Dialysis at a hospital or dialysis centre
hemodialysis.description: Haemodialysis uses a machine to filter your blood outside your body. Treatment is typically done at a hospital or dialysis centre.

overview.p1: Haemodialysis is the most common form of dialysis. Blood is taken from your body, cleaned through a special filter called a dialyser, and returned to your body.
overview.p2: Most people have haemodialysis at a hospital or dialysis centre 3 times a week, with each session lasting about 4 hours. Some people choose to do haemodialysis at home.

access.title: Vascular access
access.content: Before starting haemodialysis, you will need a permanent access point created in your arm (fistula) or a catheter in your neck or chest.

session.title: During a session
session.content: You will be connected to the dialysis machine, which draws your blood through tubes, cleans it, and returns it to your body.

monitoring.title: Monitoring
monitoring.content: Trained staff will monitor you throughout each session and check your blood pressure, weight, and other vital signs.

considerations.travel: Regular travel to dialysis centre required

work.title: Work
work.content: Many people continue to work while on haemodialysis. You may be able to arrange sessions around your work schedule.

travel.title: Travel
travel.content: Holidays require planning in advance to arrange dialysis at your destination. Holiday dialysis can be arranged in many locations worldwide.

pd.title: Peritoneal Dialysis (PD)
pd.subtitle: A home-based treatment that uses your abdomen as a natural filter
pd.description: Peritoneal dialysis uses the lining of your abdomen to filter waste from your blood. It can be done at home, giving you more flexibility.

overview.p1: Peritoneal dialysis uses the natural lining of your abdomen (peritoneum) as a filter. A sterile fluid is placed into your abdomen through a permanent tube.
overview.p2: The fluid absorbs waste products from your blood, and after a period of time (dwell time), the fluid is drained out and replaced with fresh fluid.

catheter.title: PD catheter
catheter.content: A soft tube (catheter) is surgically placed in your abdomen. This remains in place permanently and is used for all exchanges.

capd.title: Manual exchanges (CAPD)
capd.content: You drain and replace the fluid yourself 4-5 times during the day. Each exchange takes about 30-40 minutes.

apd.title: Automated PD (APD)
apd.content: A machine does the exchanges automatically while you sleep. You connect to the machine at night and it does multiple exchanges overnight.

conservative.title: Conservative Management
conservative.subtitle: Medical care focused on quality of life without dialysis
conservative.description: Conservative management focuses on managing symptoms and maintaining quality of life without dialysis or transplant.

overview.p1: Conservative management means choosing not to have dialysis or a transplant. Instead, your care focuses on managing symptoms and maintaining your quality of life for as long as possible.
overview.p2: This choice may be right for some people, particularly those who are elderly, have other serious health conditions, or who decide that the burden of dialysis outweighs the potential benefits.

considerations.decline: Kidney function will continue to decline
considerations.conversations: Important to have honest conversations with family

welcome.title: Your Personalised Treatment Options
welcome.message: Based on what you have told us, here are resources to help you explore your kidney treatment options.

messages.newlyDiagnosed: Based on what you have told us, here are resources to help you understand your kidney condition and explore your options.
messages.monitoring: As your kidneys are being monitored, these resources will help you prepare for potential future treatments.
messages.preparing: Since you are preparing for treatment soon, here are tools to help you understand and compare your options.
messages.onDialysis: As someone already on dialysis, you may want to explore other treatment options that could work for you.
messages.transplantWaiting: While you wait for a transplant, these resources can help you stay informed and prepared.
messages.postTransplant: These resources will help you maintain your health and understand your ongoing care after transplant.
messages.supporting: Here are resources to help you support your loved one through their kidney treatment journey.

welcome.reminder: Remember, your kidney team will help you make the final decision.

alert.title: Remember to save your summary
alert.message: Your information will not be saved after this session. Create a summary before you leave to keep a record of your exploration.

pathway.title: How would you like to explore?

guided.title: Your Recommended Journey
guided.description: Follow a guided step-by-step path through treatment options tailored to your situation. Perfect if you want clear direction and support.

free.title: Explore Freely
free.description: Browse all options at your own pace. Jump directly to topics that interest you. Ideal if you already know what you are looking for.

content.title: Tools to Help You Decide
content.subtitle: Explore each tool to make an informed decision

treatments.title: Treatment Options
treatments.description: Learn about all available kidney treatment options including dialysis types, transplant, and conservative care.

model.title: 3D Kidney Model
model.description: Explore interactive 3D models showing how different treatments work in your body. See the process visually.

compare.title: Compare Treatments
compare.description: See all treatments side by side. Compare what matters to you - from daily time to travel flexibility.

values.title: Values Exercise
values.description: Think about what matters most to you. This exercise helps clarify your priorities to guide your decision.

chat.title: Ask Questions
chat.description: Chat with our AI assistant about kidney treatment options. Get answers to your questions in a conversational way.

summary.title: Ready to Review Your Journey?
summary.description: View everything you have explored and create a summary to share with your kidney team at your next appointment.

compare.title: Compare Treatment Options
compare.subtitle: See how different treatments compare across key factors

values.title: What Matters Most to You?
values.subtitle: Rate how important each of these factors is in your treatment decision
values.instructions: Move the slider to indicate how important each statement is to you

intro.title: What Matters Most to You?
intro.description: Choosing a kidney treatment is a personal decision. This exercise helps you think about your values and priorities so you can discuss them with your kidney team.
intro.allAtOnce: Prefer to see all statements at once?

allAtOnce.title: Rate All Statements
allAtOnce.description: Rate each statement from 1 (Not important) to 5 (Very important).

results.title: Your Values Summary
results.description: Based on your responses, here is what matters most to you.

chat.title: Ask Questions
chat.subtitle: Chat with our AI assistant about kidney treatment options

suggestedQuestions.dialysisTypes: What is the difference between haemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis?
suggestedQuestions.transplantDuration: How long does a kidney transplant surgery take?
suggestedQuestions.travel: Can I travel while on dialysis?
suggestedQuestions.sideEffects: What are the side effects of dialysis treatment?
suggestedQuestions.suitability: How do I know if I am suitable for a transplant?
suggestedQuestions.conservativeCare: What is conservative care and who might choose it?

quickReplies.prosAndCons: What are the pros and cons?
quickReplies.dailyLife: How does this affect daily life?

privacyReminder.label: Privacy reminder:
privacyReminder.text: Please do not share personal identifying information in this chat

mockResponses.dialysisTypes: Haemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis are both ways to filter waste from your blood when your kidneys can no longer do it effectively. Haemodialysis uses a machine outside your body, typically done at a hospital 3 times a week. Peritoneal dialysis uses the lining of your abdomen as a natural filter and is done at home daily.
mockResponses.transplantSurgery: Kidney transplant surgery typically takes 2-4 hours. You would stay in hospital for about 5-7 days afterwards, and full recovery takes around 3 months.
mockResponses.travelDialysis: Yes, you can travel while on dialysis, but it requires planning. For haemodialysis, you need to arrange sessions at a dialysis centre at your destination. Peritoneal dialysis can be more flexible as you can arrange supplies to be delivered ahead of time.
mockResponses.conservativeCare: Conservative care focuses on managing symptoms and maintaining quality of life without dialysis or transplant. It may be appropriate for some people, particularly those who are elderly, have other serious health conditions, or who decide that dialysis would not significantly improve their quality of life.
mockResponses.sideEffects: Common side effects of dialysis include fatigue, low blood pressure, muscle cramps, and itching. These vary between people and can often be managed with adjustments to your treatment.
mockResponses.suitability: Transplant suitability depends on your overall health, other medical conditions, and lifestyle factors. Your kidney team will assess you through tests and examinations. Age alone does not disqualify you - many people in their 70s and 80s receive transplants.
mockResponses.tellMeMore: I would be happy to provide more details. What specific aspect would you like to know more about?
mockResponses.default: Thank you for your question. Based on NHS guidelines, I can provide information about kidney treatment options. Is there a specific aspect you would like to explore further?

navigation.subtitle: Continue your journey by exploring treatment options

kidney.label: Kidney
kidney.description: The kidney filters waste and excess fluid from your blood. Each kidney is about the size of your fist.

renalArtery.label: Renal Artery
renalArtery.description: The renal artery carries blood from your heart to your kidney for filtering.

renalVein.label: Renal Vein
renalVein.description: The renal vein carries filtered blood from your kidney back to your heart.

ureter.label: Ureter
ureter.description: The ureter is a tube that carries urine from your kidney to your bladder.

adrenalGland.label: Adrenal Gland
adrenalGland.description: The adrenal gland sits on top of each kidney and produces hormones.

summary.title: Your Session Summary
summary.subtitle: Review what you have explored and create a summary for your kidney team

journeyDescriptions.newlyDiagnosed: You are at the beginning of your kidney care journey and learning about your condition.
journeyDescriptions.monitoring: Your kidney function is being monitored regularly by your healthcare team.
journeyDescriptions.preparing: You are preparing to start treatment and exploring your options.
journeyDescriptions.onDialysis: You are currently receiving dialysis treatment.
journeyDescriptions.transplantWaiting: You are on the waiting list for a kidney transplant.
journeyDescriptions.postTransplant: You have received a kidney transplant and are in recovery or ongoing care.

summary.question2: What would my daily life look like with each treatment?
summary.question3: How do I start the process for my preferred treatment?

step1.title: Review this summary
step1.description: Take time to look through what you have explored and think about any additional questions.

step2.title: Share with family or carers
step2.description: If you have support at home, discuss your thoughts with them.

step3.title: Discuss with your kidney care team
step3.description: Bring this summary to your next appointment to discuss your options.

privacy.title: Your Privacy
privacy.text: This information is stored only in your browser and will be cleared when you end your session. No personal data has been saved on any server.

disclaimer.title: Important Reminder
disclaimer.text: This summary is for information purposes only and does not constitute medical advice. Always discuss your treatment options with your kidney care team who know your individual circumstances.

summary.printInstructions: Print this summary to take with you to your kidney care team.

cta.title: Ready for your next appointment?

summary.printFooter: Generated by NHS Kidney Treatment Decision Aid. This summary is for discussion with your healthcare team only.
